keyMoments.title: Luffy Meets Rayleigh at Amazon Lily
keyMoments.description: Carried by Jinbe, Luffy searches for Law and the Heart Pirates but instead encounters Silvers Rayleigh, setting up a crucial turning point in his journey.
keyMoments.significance: This meeting begins the path toward Luffy's two-year training and growth.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Receives His Straw Hat Back
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh returns Luffy's iconic straw hat, the symbol of his promise to Shanks and his pirate identity, representing Luffy beginning to heal from Ace's death.
keyMoments.significance: The straw hat's return marks Luffy reclaiming his resolve and identity after the traumatic loss of Ace.

name.japanese: シルバーズ・レイリー

keyMoments.title: Rayleigh Arrives at Amazon Lily
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh emerges from the Calm Belt after killing a Sea King and encounters the Heart Pirates, asking about Luffy's whereabouts.
keyMoments.significance: Marks Rayleigh's arrival to find and help Luffy after the Marineford War.

keyMoments.title: Rayleigh Returns the Straw Hat
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh returns Luffy's iconic straw hat to him, helping Luffy reclaim his identity and resolve.
keyMoments.significance: A pivotal emotional moment showing Rayleigh's role as a mentor and guide.
keyMoments.quote: Here, I believe this belongs to you.

keyMoments.title: Rayleigh Reveals Kuma's True Intentions
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh explains that Kuma was a Revolutionary Army member who deliberately sent Luffy to Amazon Lily to protect him, not to harm the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.significance: This revelation recontextualizes Kuma's actions at Sabaody and shows his sacrifice.
keyMoments.quote: Kuma told me he was a member of the Revolutionary Army. He deliberately sent you here to Amazon Lily, knowing you would be safe.

keyMoments.title: Rayleigh Offers to Train Luffy
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh proposes training Luffy instead of returning him to Sabaody, explaining that Luffy needs to become stronger to survive the New World.
keyMoments.significance: This offer sets up the two-year timeskip and Luffy's Haki training, one of the most pivotal moments in the series.
keyMoments.quote: I cannot bring you back to Sabaody Archipelago. You would suffer the same fate. But I have an offer for you - let me train you.

relationships.description: Rayleigh befriends Hancock and her sisters during his stay at Amazon Lily.

evolutionMoments.description: Rayleigh meets and befriends Boa Hancock and her sisters at Amazon Lily.

reveals.information: Rayleigh reveals that Kuma told him about being in the Revolutionary Army and deliberately sent Luffy to Amazon Lily

keyMoments.title: Hancock's Marriage Fantasy
keyMoments.description: Hancock fantasizes about marrying Luffy and asks Nyon about proper marriage ceremonies, showing her deep romantic feelings for him.
keyMoments.significance: Provides comedic relief and reinforces Hancock's character trait of being deeply in love with Luffy.
keyMoments.quote: What would I have to do to have a proper marriage ceremony?

keyMoments.title: Hancock Befriends Rayleigh
keyMoments.description: Hancock meets Silvers Rayleigh and they quickly become friendly, facilitating Luffy's future training.
keyMoments.significance: Rayleigh's friendship with Hancock helps enable Luffy's training at Amazon Lily.

relationships.description: Hancock befriends Rayleigh during his visit to Amazon Lily.

evolutionMoments.description: Hancock meets and befriends Rayleigh, facilitating Luffy's training.

keyMoments.title: Jinbe Helps Luffy Search for Law
keyMoments.description: Jinbe carries Luffy on his back as they search for Law and the Heart Pirates, showing his continued support for Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Jinbe's dedication to helping Luffy recover and move forward.

name.japanese: トラファルガー・ロー

keyMoments.title: Law Encounters Rayleigh
keyMoments.description: The Heart Pirates encounter Rayleigh in the Calm Belt, and Rayleigh asks about Luffy after seeing the straw hat.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Law's connection to Luffy and foreshadows his interest in the Will of D.

keyMoments.title: Law and Heart Pirates Depart
keyMoments.description: Law and the Heart Pirates leave Amazon Lily after treating Luffy. Law reflects on looking forward to seeing what trouble 'D' will cause.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the end of Law's immediate involvement in Luffy's recovery and hints at his fascination with the Will of D.
keyMoments.quote: I cannot wait to see 'D' causing trouble again.

reveals.information: Law expresses interest in seeing what trouble those with the Will of D will cause in the future

keyMoments.title: Usopp's Desperate Escape Attempt
keyMoments.description: Despite being overweight from eating on the Boin Islands, Usopp desperately tries to escape to reunite with Luffy, demonstrating his unwavering loyalty.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Usopp's dedication to his captain and crew despite physical hardships.
keyMoments.quote: I have to get back to Luffy! I can't abandon my captain!

keyMoments.title: Heracles Rescues Usopp
keyMoments.description: Heracles saves Usopp from being consumed by the carnivorous Boin Island, foreshadowing their mentor-student relationship.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Heracles teaching Usopp about Pop Greens and combat during the timeskip.

relationships.description: Heracles rescues Usopp and will become his mentor during the timeskip.

evolutionMoments.description: Heracles rescues Usopp from the carnivorous island, beginning their relationship.

keyMoments.title: Heracles Rescues Usopp
keyMoments.description: Heracles saves Usopp from the carnivorous Boin Island despite Usopp's reckless escape attempt.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Heracles' protective nature and foreshadows him becoming Usopp's mentor.

relationships.description: Heracles rescues Usopp and will become his mentor, teaching him about Pop Greens and survival.

evolutionMoments.description: Heracles rescues Usopp from being consumed by the island.
